intro: Boottia rohrbachiana, commonly known as the Rohrbach's boottia, is a rare and specialized plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation to extreme environments.
